pullRequest.body:
Based on @CBirkbeck's work on modular forms.

nodes.body: The only part that is specific about `exp` is that `iteratedDeriv n exp = exp` right? If so could you prove the general result instead, and then use [iteratedDeriv_eq_iterate](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Calculus/IteratedDeriv.html#iteratedDeriv_eq_iterate) and [Real.iter_deriv_exp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/ExpDeriv.html#Real.iter_deriv_exp) to get your result?

> Is there any reason not to do this for `NormedSpace.exp` directly? (of course, we'll still want the versions specialized to `Complex.exp` and `Real.exp` too.)

I was going to ask for that, but then realized that we could refactor this whole file to go through `NormedSpace.exp`, so maybe we can do that in one go later. Also, I think the real generalization is that this is not a lemma about exponentials at all (although the fact that I'm the only one to notice it makes me worry about my own sanity) : `iteratedDeriv n (f (c * .)) x = c ^ n * iteratedDeriv n f (c * x)` is true for all `C^n` functions, right ?
Also, doing the proof in the general setting for `NormedSpace.exp` might be unexpectedly tricky, `iteratedFDeriv` is an annoying beast to fight...

Seems true. I'll take a look at updating the PR later
```lean
import Mathlib

variable {𝕜 : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] [NormedAlgebra 𝕜 ℂ]

theorem xxx (n : ℕ) (c : 𝕜) (f : 𝕜 → 𝕜) (h : ContDiff 𝕜 n f) : iteratedDeriv n (fun x => f (c * x)) = fun x => c ^ n * iteratedDeriv n f (c * x) := by
  induction n with
  | zero => simp
  | succ n ih =>
    funext x
    rw [pow_succ, iteratedDeriv_succ, ih h.of_succ, deriv_const_mul_field]
    rw [iteratedDeriv_succ]
    rw [← Function.comp_def ]
    rw [deriv.comp x (h.differentiable_iteratedDeriv _ (Nat.cast_lt.mpr n.lt_succ_self)).differentiableAt (differentiableAt_id'.const_mul _)]
    rw [deriv_const_mul _ differentiableAt_id', deriv_id'']
    ring

theorem iteratedDeriv_cexp_const_mul_ (n : ℕ) (c : ℂ) :
    (iteratedDeriv n fun s : ℂ => Complex.exp (c * s)) = fun s => c ^ n * Complex.exp (c * s) := by
  rw [xxx]
  funext x
  rw [@iteratedDeriv_eq_iterate]
  rw [Complex.iter_deriv_exp]
```
@Ruben-VandeVelde this still has a build failure
I think this should go in `Analysis.Calculus.IteratedDeriv.Lemmas` (I know there has been some file shuffling recently).

:v: Ruben-VandeVelde can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7674083748/job/20918005967)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7674083748/job/20918006400)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7674083748/job/20918006752)

Thanks, I think these should be `@[simp]`.

bors d+
~~Is there any reason not to do this for `NormedSpace.exp` directly? (of course, we'll still want the versions specialized to `Complex.exp` and `Real.exp` too.)~~ Anatole's suggestion is far better.

Thanks, I think these should be `@[simp]`.

bors d+

I think the only real reason to have it (separate from the more general one) is if we mark it `simp`.
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem iteratedDeriv_cexp_const_mul (n : ℕ) (c : ℂ) :
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem iteratedDeriv_exp_const_mul (n : ℕ) (c : ℝ) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: iteratedDeriv_const_{s,}mul, iteratedDeriv_{c,}exp_const_mul
